ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: My only complaint was that I couldnt speed up the videos and I could have used a brief background prior to reading the papers as to why they were selected and what impact they had on the subject matter.

I love this course. The reading material was very well selected and provided a great background to accompany the interactive course material. I really enjoyed the final prescription assignment, and putting all the pieces together. I would have loved to do more of this, as this was when I could really see what I'd learned and what I was still having trouble conceptualizing. It would have been nice to have some sort of prescription assignment for each module.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The field trip to Panama, visiting lecturers and student presentations.
All of it -- was a multi-dimensional, well-rounded, excellent course.
The case study applications, and hearing from guest speakers
I liked that it was organized into modules
Combinantion of learing in the classroom and the field
the guest lectures were wonderful. very well chosen and informative, and a great opportunity to see what researchers are doing in various aspects of the restoration field.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Perhaps adjust the class sessions so the student dialogues are more engaging. Sometimes it felt like only 2-3 people talked.
Few, if any. Loved it.

Maybe just some of the organization aspects, such as assigning readings well in advance (including additional readings from guest speakers). Students should understand how much work is involved for the assignments each week
Discussion of readings or topics of the week

The discussions were wonderful, but like most discussion courses at Yale, I think they could have benefitted from a bit more structure at times and could be moderated to keep the educational goals as priority in the discussion points. This was not often needed, but for a couple times in the class.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: I could have used more in class lectures. I'm sure there are things that I missed in terms of the important take-aways from the videos.
Very appropriate.
Yes. the readings, on-line lectures and in class discussion/guest lectures complemented each other very well. The field trip was a well thought out integration of all these materials.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I'm an MF planning to work in the US, so it was a little outside my comfort zone. I loved it though, as it provides more context to me as i learn more about international markets.
A bit outside of scope of work, but immensely valuable information that allows me to approach my work from new perspectives. Highly worth the work I put in.

The course directly facilitates my interest in tropical ecology and goals to work in tropical restoration. The course integrates concepts from other courses in the school and provides a holistic integration of my academic goals in understanding restoration, ecology, rural development, and agroforestry. This has been an invaluable course for me here in FES.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To learn more about tropical forest ecology and because I needed a forest health credit. I'm really glad I did take this course because I learned way more than I imagined and became really interested in the subject matter.
Gotta love the tropics.
I'm interested in the tropics, and this built off of my silvicultural knowledge as well
I thought it would be important to know about restoration of forest habitats and could use the things I learned to make better suggestions for my summer research in a tropical forest

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Exceeded my expectations. Loved the field trip to Panama.
Yes.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Go on the field trip! Mark is amazing and it's a really cool opportunity to see him in yet another forest where he knows everything. Loved getting to know my classmates better too.
Do the readings -- it's well worth it.
Stay on top of the assigned readings and lectures that are due every Sunday. Don't wait until the last minute because some of those exercises can take longer than you anticipate.

If you don't have time to do all the readings, read a little bit of each paper, and bring questions to class. the discussions are a great way to pick each others brains, classmates and professors alike.
